benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Remove tags from invoice item

covered: DELETE - Valid Deletion: Success cases with and without tagDef, subset removals, idempotent behavior when no tags exist (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC18).
DELETE - Non-Existent Resource: 404 when invoice item does not exist (TC08).
DELETE - Concurrency: High-concurrency scenario to detect race conditions/performance issues (TC17).
Input Validation (supplemental): Invalid invoiceItemId (400), malformed/partial tagDef (400), empty tagDef (treated as no-op 204), extra query params tolerance (TC06, TC07, TC09, TC13, TC16).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (400 on missing), optional Reason/Comment accepted and sanitized (TC03, TC10, TC15, TC18).
Authentication/Availability (supplemental): 401 for invalid token, 503 for service down; integration dependency behavior considered (TC11, TC12, TC19).
Large input edge case: Very large number of tagDef values handled (TC14).
gaps: DELETE - Soft Deletes: No scenario clarifies whether tag removal is soft vs hard delete or validates any soft-deletion flags/audit trails.

DELETE - Concurrency detail: No explicit test for two simultaneous deletes on the same invoice item/tags verifying idempotent outcomes and absence of conflicts; no scenario where the invoice item itself is deleted concurrently leading to deterministic 204/404.
Authorization vs Authentication: No 403 scenario for authenticated user lacking permission/tenant/account scope.
Idempotency repeatability: No test explicitly repeating the same DELETE request twice to confirm idempotent 204 and unchanged state.
Query param collection format: No explicit verification of multi-format encoding (tagDef=uuid1&tagDef=uuid2), ordering, duplicates handling, or whitespace/case normalization.
Error response contract: No validation of error schema/headers (e.g., Content-Type on errors, produces application/json vs 204 with no body).
Mixed-validity inputs: No case where tagDef contains a mix of valid and malformed/unknown UUIDs to confirm whole-request failure vs partial processing policy.
Audit/logging side effects: While dependency failure is tested, there is no positive verification that audit entries are created correctly on success.
recommendations: Add a soft-delete behavior test (if applicable): verify whether tag associations are soft-deleted and confirm via subsequent retrieval/audit endpoints.
Add targeted concurrency scenarios: two concurrent DELETEs on the same invoice item/tags; concurrent DELETE while invoice item is being removed; assert deterministic outcomes and no data races.
Add authorization test: authenticated user without proper permissions should receive 403; include tenant/account scoping if relevant.
Add idempotency test: send the same DELETE twice (same tagDef or no tagDef) and verify second call returns 204 with no changes.
Verify query parameter collection format: repeated tagDef parameters (multi), order-independence, duplicate UUIDs, trimming/normalization of values.
Validate error contract: ensure error responses include expected JSON schema and headers; ensure 204 responses have no body and appropriate headers.
Test mixed-validity tagDef arrays (some valid, some malformed/unknown) to confirm validation policy (fail-fast 400 vs partial processing).
Verify positive audit logging on success (entries created with CreatedBy/Reason/Comment), not only behavior when audit service is unavailable.
